# edar

<!-- badges: start -->
[![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/soutomas/edar/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/soutomas/edar/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml)
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/edar)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=edar)
[![](http://cranlogs.r-pkg.org/badges/edar)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=edar)

<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of edar is to provide some convenient functions to facilitate common tasks in exploratory data analysis.

## Citation

Sou T (2025). _edar: Convenient Functions for Exploratory Data Analysis_. R package version 0.0.6, <https://github.com/soutomas/edar>.

```{r}
citation("edar")
```

## Installation

``` r
# From CRAN 
install.packages("edar")

# From GitHub - for the development version
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("soutomas/edar")
```

## Example

### Summary 

It is often helpful to see a quick summary of the dataset. 

```{r}
library(edar)

# Data 
dat = mtcars |> mutate(across(c(am,carb,cyl,gear,vs),factor))

# Summaries of all continuous variables. 
dat |> summ_by()

# Summaries of a selected variable after grouping. 
dat |> summ_by(mpg,vs)

# Summaries of all categorical variables. 
dat |> summ_cat()

```

### Tables

Results can be viewed directly in a flextable object.  

```{r eval=TRUE, out.width="70%"}
# Show data frame as a flextable object. 
dat |> summ_by(mpg,vs) |> ft()
```


### Visualisation 

Variables can be quickly visualised for exploratory graphical analysis. 

```{r eval=TRUE, out.width="70%"}
# Scatter plot showing correlation. 
dat |> ggxy(hp,disp)

# Histograms of all continuous variables. 
dat |> gghist()

# Box plots stratified by categorical variables. 
dat |> ggbox(mpg)

# Violin plots stratified by categorical variables. 
dat |> ggvio(mpg)
```

### Labels

A label indicating the current source file with a time stamp can be easily generated for annotation. 

```{r eval=FALSE}
# To generate a source file label for annotation.
lab = label_src()
```

```{r eval=FALSE}
# A source file label can be directly added to the flextable output. 
dat |> summ_by(mpg,vs) |> ft(src=1)
```

```{r fig.width=5, fig.height=4, eval=FALSE}
# A source file label can be directly added to a ggplot object. 
p = dat |> ggxy(hp,disp)
p |> ggsrc()
```
